CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid material names:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| FF |
| AFM |
| PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM |

Explanation:

* FF (short for "filling factor") is a property of the material, specifically the highest reported to date for side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers.
* AFM (short for "atomic force microscopy") is a technique used to study the surface morphology of the active layers.
* PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM is the name of a specific blend film composed of PBDT-TDPP-S and PC71BM, which is a property of the material.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| FF |

Explanation:

* FF (short for "filling factor") is a property of the material, specifically the highest reported to date for side-chain D-A conjugated copolymers.

The following entities do not clearly refer to material properties and were removed:

* AFM (short for "atomic force microscopy") is a technique used to study the surface morphology of the active layers, but it is not a material property.
* PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM is the name of a specific blend film composed of PBDT-TDPP-S and PC71BM, but it is not a material property.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To our best knowledge , the FF is the highest reported to date for side - chain D-A conjugated copolymers The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 ° C. Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions ( see Supporting Information ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| FF |
| 120 ° C |
| PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM |

Explanation:

* FF (short for "filling factor") is a property value mentioned in the sentence "The surface morphology of the active layers was studied using atomic force microscopy (AFM) under tapping mode in order to further understand why the device exhibited better photovoltaic properties at the annealing temperature of 120 °C."
* 120 °C is a property value mentioned in the same sentence, referring to the annealing temperature.
* PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM is a property value mentioned in the sentence "Figure S8 shows typical AFM topography of the PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM blend film in unannealed and annealed conditions (see Supporting Information)." It refers to the name of the blend film being studied.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 120 °C |

Explanation:

* 120 °C is the only property value mentioned in the paragraph that clearly refers to the value of a material property (annealing temperature).

The other mentioned entities, FF and PBDT-TDPP-S:PC71BM, do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and were therefore removed from the table.
